Package controller.datastorage

Class DataStorage

  • java.lang.Object
    • controller.datastorage.DataStorage
  • public class DataStorage
extends java.lang.Object
    This class is used to generate directories and files to be used for data storage for the McGill Rocket Team Ground Station 2020.

    Raw data is stored in .txt files. Parsed data will be added to .CSV files.

    To improve this class, a method which to write data to CSV or text files needs to be written. This method would invoke other methods in this class; doing so would hide the complexity of the data storage process, and simplify a program that can be used to save data received from antennas.

    Author:
    Jasper Yun

    • Method Detail

      • make1Dir

        private static void make1Dir​(java.io.File file)
        Creates a single directory with a specific input path determined by the programmer. Because McGill Rocket Team will consistently use the same hierarchy of directories for data storage, we will hardcode the paths in another method.

        This method also prints on the console to indicate whether the directory creation was successful.

        This code comes from Mkyong.

        Parameters:
        file - - File object containing the path for the new directory

      • make2Dirs

        private static void make2Dirs​(java.io.File file)
        Creates multiple directories given an input path. Prints on the console to indicate whether the directory creation was successful.

        This code comes from Mkyong.

        Parameters:
        file - - File object containing the path for the new directories

      • makeFolders

        protected static void makeFolders()
        The parent folder is called "storage". It is created in the parent folder of the directory of this Java class.

        The subfolders of "storage" are "telemetry", "gps", "raw_telemetry", "raw_gps", "antenna_angles", "serial".

        If the folders already exist, then nothing happens.

      • dateFormats

        protected static java.lang.String[] dateFormats()
        Formats the current time and date into a format for filename use or for use in the column entries of CSV files.

        The filename format is "yyyy-MM-dd--HH-mm-ss".
        The column entry format is "yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm:ss:SSS", where SSS represents milliseconds to three digits.

        Returns:
        formatted - String[] String array containing the formatted dates.

      • createTelemetryHeader

        static void createTelemetryHeader​(java.lang.String[] formattedDates)
        Takes in an argument of a String array containing the current date in a specific format. The method uses the first string to create a file with the current time in the filename. The method then creates a header row in a CSV file with column names pertinent to telemetry data storage.

        Parameters:
        formattedDates - - String[] Contains current time and date formatted appropriately

      • createGPSHeader

        Parameters:

      • saveTelemetryCSV

        static boolean saveTelemetryCSV​(java.lang.String[] formattedDates,
                                java.lang.String fileTime,
                                double[] data)
        Writes telemetry data to an existing CSV file. The data is passed into the method by a double array; the data is written onto a single line in the CSV file. The end of the writing process adds a newline. Then the CSV file is saved.

        If the length of the input double is not exactly 10, the data is assumed to be corrupted and will not be written to the CSV.

        Parameters:
        formattedDates - - String[] 2-entry string array with formatted date strings
        fileTime - - String Date and Time that is in the file name that the data should be written to
        data - - double[] Double array with telemetry data
        Returns:
        success - boolean Flag indicating whether the save operation failed at any point

      • saveGPSCSV

        static boolean saveGPSCSV​(java.lang.String[] formattedDates,
                          java.lang.String fileTime,
                          double[] data)
        Writes GPS data to an existing CSV file. The data is passed into the method by a double array with 6 entries; the data is written onto a single line in the CSV file. The end of the writing process adds a newline. Then the CSV file is saved.

        Parameters:
        formattedDates - - String[] 2-entry string array with formatted date strings
        fileTime - - String Date and Time that is in the file name that the data should be written to
        data - - double[] 6-entry double array with GPS data
        Returns:
        success - boolean Flag indicating whether the save operation failed at any point

      • saveTelemetryRaw

        static void saveTelemetryRaw​(java.lang.String[] formattedDates,
                             java.lang.String fileTime,
                             java.lang.String data)
        Saves raw telemetry data received in the form of a string to a text file.

        Parameters:
        formattedDates - - String[] Contains the current date and time formatted appropriately
        fileTime - - String Date/Time contained in the name of the file to save the raw data to
        data - - String Data to be saved

      • readLine

        static java.lang.String readLine​(java.lang.String filePath)
                          throws java.lang.Exception
        Reads a single line from a file and returns a string with the data that is read. The method will be used to read raw data from text files and pass the data as strings to the methods to save telemetry or GPS data into CSVs.

        Currently, the path to the file being read from is a testReading.txt file which contains a single line of comma-separated values. This path is hardcoded for testing.

        Parameters:
        filePath - - String path to the file to be read from
        Returns:
        line - String single line of data read from a file to be written to the CSV
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - - for any errors related to nonexisting files

      • main

        public static void main​(java.lang.String[] args)
                 throws java.lang.Exception
        Main method of the program. It begins by checking whether the necessary folders have been created for data storage. If not, the directories will be created with the parent folder name "storage".

        The method will then create .CSV files for telemetry and GPS data storage, and .txt files for telemetry, GPS, and antenna angle raw data storage.

        Currently, more code is written to test some of the methods for saving data to CSV and/or text files. However, more tests need to be done, and the tests must be more rigorous.

        The file tests.java in the same package contains a method runTests() that tests the methods in this class for creating directories and creating new CSV and text files.

        Parameters:
        args - - arguments as required by syntax
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - - for any errors related to non-existing files
